title: Authorizing Cameron County, Texas, To Construct, Maintain, and Operate a Pedestrian Border Crossing at the Gateway International Bridge Land Port of Entry
summary: The document is a presidential permit issued on August 20, 2025, authorizing Cameron County, Texas, to construct, maintain, and operate a pedestrian border crossing at the Gateway International Bridge Land Port of Entry in Brownsville, Texas. The permit outlines several conditions, including compliance with federal, state, and local laws, environmental mitigation measures, and regular inspections by authorized agencies. The permittee is responsible for obtaining necessary permits, ensuring the safety and maintenance of the border facilities, and providing inspection facilities to U.S. Customs and Border Protection at no cost to the United States. The permit also requires coordination with relevant agencies and the government of Mexico, and it is subject to termination or amendment by the President. The permit is valid for five years from the date of issuance if construction has not commenced by that time.
